author: BBC News
description:
Video footage has emerged which shows Israeli security forces shooting dead two Palestinians after they had surrendered in Jenin in the occupied the West Bank.

The two men are seen leaving a building and surrendering, before being ordered back inside and shot dead at point blank range.   

The Palestinian authorities have described the killing as a “summary execution”.  The Israelis said the two Palestinians were wanted men.  They’ve announced military and police investigations into the killings. 

Reeta Chakrabarti presents BBC News at Ten reporting by Jon Donnison in Jerusalem.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Video show Israeli forces shooting dead Palestinian prisoners in occupied West Bank | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, Adam is joined by Claer Barrett, Consumer Editor at the Financial Times and Helen Miller, Director at the Institute for Fiscal Studies to unpack how the budget will you. 

The Prime Minister Keir Starmer defended the government's tax-raising budget, saying it will help lift hundreds of thousands of children out of poverty - with the IFS saying households face a ‘truly dismal’ rise in their spending power.

#BBCNews
title: The Budget: What does it actually mean for you? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
President Vladimir Putin has doubled down on his core demands for ending the war in Ukraine, stating that Russia will lay down arms only if Kyiv's troops withdraw from territory claimed by Moscow.
 
Putin has long pushed for legal recognition of the Ukrainian territories Russia has seized by force.
 
They include the Crimean peninsula, which it illegally annexed in 2014, and the Donbas, made up of Luhansk and Donetsk, which Moscow now occupies for the most part.
 
For Kyiv, which has ruled out relinquishing the parts of the Donbas it still holds, rewarding Russia for its aggression is a non-starter.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Russia #Ukraine #BBCNews
title: Vladimir Putin doubles down on demands for Ukrainian territory ahead of talks with US | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Macy's 99th Thanksgiving parade in New York City kicks off. #Thanksgiving #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Firefighters search for missing after Hong Kong tower blocks fire  | BBC News
 
Firefighters are still searching for hundreds of missing people after a massive fire tore through multiple high-rise residential buildings in Hong Kong.

At least 83 people are now known to have died in the blaze at Wang Fuk Court's complex, which is home to thousands.

The tower blocks had been undergoing extensive renovations - and while the exact cause for the fire is unclear, police say materials on the outside of the buildings may have facilitated its spread.

Three construction firm executives have been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter and gross negligence.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#HongKong #BBCNews
title: Firefighters search for missing after Hong Kong tower blocks fire | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Footage shows fire spread in seconds at Hong Kong tower block. #HongKong #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
A year into a ceasefire which ended the latest war between Israel and Hezbollah, the Israeli military is continuing to carry out drone attacks on Lebanon.
 
Israel says it is striking targets linked to Hezbollah, which it claims is violating the ceasefire by rebuilding its military capabilities.
 
BBC Middle East correspondent Hugo Bachega has been telling the Global News Podcast about his visit to the communities of southern Lebanon, where people live in constant fear of attack.
 
Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast
 
#Lebanon #BBCNews
title: Peace eludes Lebanon one year on from ceasefire with Israel | Global News Podcast

author: BBC News
description:
The Afghan suspect in the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington DC previously worked with the CIA in Afghanistan, the CIA director has said. 
 
The injured soldiers, 24-year-old Andrew Wolfe and Sarah Beckstrom, 20, have come through surgery, but remain in a critical condition. 
 
US Attorney for the District of Columbia Jeanine Pirro said the suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, drove thousands of miles across the country from Washington state before the attack on Wednesday. 
 
Lakanwal was shot by another soldier during the incident and was taken to hospital. US President Donald Trump said he was "severely wounded".

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Washington #US #BBCNews
title: Suspect who shot National Guard soldiers in DC worked with CIA in Afghanistan | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Gaten Matarazzo, who plays Dustin, on life after Stranger Things as final season launches. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Net migration to the UK fell by two-thirds in the year ending June 2025 compared with the previous 12 months, provisional figures indicate.
 
The difference between the number of people arriving in the country and those leaving was 204,000, down from 649,000, with the fall mainly driven by fewer arrivals for work and study reasons, the Office for National Statistics said.
 
It comes as Home Office figures show the number of people who claimed asylum in the year to September 2025 reached a record high of 110,051.
 
The figures also show the number of asylum seekers in hotels as of September rose by 2% compared with the same time last year.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#UK #Migration #BBCNews
title: UK net migration down 80% from its peak in 2023 | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
A limited form of military service will be re-introduced in France in response to growing fears of a confrontation with Russia.
 
More than 25 years after conscription was phased out, the plan will see young men and women volunteering for a paid 10 months of military training.
 
The new "national service" will be brought in gradually from next summer, mainly for 18- and 19-year-olds, who will receive at least €800 (£700) a month.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#France #BBCNews
title: France brings back limited military service with 3,000 volunteers | BBC News

title: Bike thief caught on camera stealing Christmas Nutcracker statue from outside Scottish bar. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
At least 43 people have died in Indonesia after flooding which has also affected parts of Thailand and Malaysia. 
 
The city of Hat Yai, a business hub bordering Malaysia, recorded its heaviest rainfall in 300 years.
 
The record floods have prompted authorities to deploy military ships and helicopters to support relief efforts.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Indonesia #Thailand #BBCNews
title: At least 43 people killed in Indonesia floods | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Pope Leo has arrived in Turkey at the start of the first foreign trip of his papacy.
 
During his visit he will mark an historic Christian anniversary, before heading to Lebanon days after Israeli airstrikes on its capital, Beirut.
 
Visits to both countries had originally been planned by the late Pope Francis.
 
Pope Leo said the message of his trip is to show that "all men (and) women can truly be brothers and sisters, in spite of differences, in spite of different religions, in spite of different beliefs".
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#PopeLeo #Turkey #BBCNews
title: Pope Leo arrives in Turkey on first foreign trip of papacy | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
At least 55 people have been killed in a huge fire engulfing a high-rise public housing complex in Hong Kong, and hundreds are still unaccounted for.
 
The fire tore through seven of eight tower blocks in Tai Po district. Fires are under control in four, officials said.
 
Wang Fuk Court is home to some 4,600 residents, according to the latest figures.
 
It's unclear how many were inside when the fire broke out.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#HongKong #BBCNews
title: Hundreds still missing after Hong Kong apartment blocks fire | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: What we know as Hong Kong fire kills at least 55 people. #BBCNews
